intro: Sandoricum indicum var. cochinchinense, commonly known as the white sandoricum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
